programme.title: The Last Alaskans
programme.desc: Winter is fast approaching, and moose-hunting season begins. Tyler stalks an elusive bull, while Charlie gets a taste of why the region is known as starvation country.

programme.title: Dodo Heroes
programme.desc: The Sheldrick Wildlife Trust rescue baby animals in Kenya. They saved elephant Malkia when she was six months old. Now shes ready to go back into the wild.

programme.title: Bad Dog
programme.desc: Monkey Boo has free reign of the house and his owners heart and Duke, a Labradoodle, is obsessed with getting into anything that might contain food.

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: The Browns try to adapt after closing their dream homestead. They face a new start with the skills and knowledge from over 35 years in the Alaskan wilderness.

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: The Browns embark on a quest to discover new land that steers them into unfamiliar terrain. There, they pledge to rebuild a life of independence in the bush.

programme.title: Fish Or Die
programme.desc: The guys are in Borneo, looking for a fish close to extinction - the mahseer. To find it, they risk entering the territory of the headhunting Dayak people.

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: The Irwins return to the Steve Irwin Wildlife Reserve to study crocodiles. It’s an epic trip as Robert leads the croc catching team for the very first time, while Bindi and Chandler reveal a life-changing announcement.

programme.title: Big Cat Tales
programme.desc: A dispersed Marsh Pride faces weakened protection from the six male warrior lions. Plus, a cheetah works tirelessly to raise her three new cubs.

programme.title: Saved By The Barn
programme.desc: Dwight the cow is taken to Indiana to receive hydrotherapy. Meanwhile, Dan welcomes over a dozen exotic farm animals and Lola the goat is ready to walk again!

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: A dog is rushed to the clinic after being hit by a car. Four rats must be neutered before adoption and a little girl rescues kittens in Grand Junction.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: CEO of Zappos thinks his employees deserve a nap room! Wayde and Brett accept the challenge to create a 24 ft long tank with individual sleeping pods.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Investigator Marlynn Barkley tries to save a dog that has been left for dead by its owners. Later, she makes an emergency dash to the hospital.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: A cat is rescued and brought into the shelter after having its paws removed in an act of deliberate cruelty.

programme.title: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: Marty must move a failing cabin onto a flood-proof foundation while Matt teaches an ill mother how to face her fear of invasive hogs.

programme.title: Fish Or Die
programme.desc: The guys are in Borneo, looking for a fish close to extinction - the mahseer. To find it, they risk entering the territory of the headhunting Dayak people.

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Pete and his gang ride out to build a double-decker hideout in Texas Hill Country. NTAndS creates rustic bliss in six oak trees with a saloon-style first floor.

programme.title: Pit Bulls And Parolees
programme.desc: A year after losing their house in a fire, M2 and Kanani do something special for the dog who saved their lives. And, a parolee returns after a mysterious absence.

programme.title: My Cat From Hell
programme.desc: Jackson helps a couple whose cats fight so much, they moved to a bigger house to keep them apart. Plus, feral shop cat Greenies spraying is threatening business.

programme.title: Treetop Cat Rescue
programme.desc: Shaun heads out on a solo night mission to rescue a cat thats been missing for 3 weeks. Plus, in Bonney Lake, Tom and Shaun attempt to rescue a feral cat.

programme.title: Treetop Cat Rescue
programme.desc: Shaun and Tom investigate whether a stranded cat is really who its owner says it is. Plus, Tom attempts to reunite a feline with his canine companion.

programme.title: Expedition Bigfoot
programme.desc: Mireya and Ronny make a powerful discovery in the area around the nest. And, Bryce suspects Bigfoot is emitting infrasound to repel the team from its territory.

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People

programme.title: Treetop Cat Rescue

programme.title: Worlds Most Scenic Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Looping around Andalucia, the luxury Al Andalus train takes in some of the most beautiful cities in Spain. Travelling south from Seville, cameras focus on Jerez, where the horses of the Royal Andalusian School of Equestrian Art are trained. There is also a look at the clifftop town of Ronda, before rolling on to the ancient cities of Granada and Cordoba. Narrated by Bill Nighy.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Tom and Jerry are in the middle of it when Tom hears someone singing the tale of a cat who met his unfortunate, painful end chasing a much superior opponent. The song is about underestimating your opponent. Every time Tom stops chasing Jerry, the music stops. When Tom resumes, the music resumes. This back and forth continues until the chase takes Tom right past a Singing Uncle Pecos. Tom skids to a stop causing Uncle Pecos to stop singing. Tom wants to prove the lyrics of Uncle Pecos song wrong, but in the end, Toms ego proves to everyone, including himself, that he is very much the subject of Uncle Pecos cautionary tale.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: After another attempt on Jerrys part to elude Tom, Jerry overhears Rick and Ginger talk about the possibility of getting rid of that "useless cat." When Ginger sounds like shes considering the possibility, Jerry cant believe his ears!

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Spike hasnt been the best role model for his boy when it comes to being a good sport. You could even say Spikes a sore loser. Thats why Spike recruits Tom and Jerry to help teach the little guy how to lose gracefully. When Tom beats Tyke at a game of tic-tac-toe Tyke puts the "sore" into "sore loser" by biting Toms finger when Tom extends it for a friendly post-game handshake. Tom forces Jerry to take turns playing various games with Tyke (e.g. Checkers, basketball, hopscotch, etc…). Each time they win, Tyke takes it out on them. When Tom and Jerry start throwing the games, Spikes right there to dole out his own punishment for letting Tyke win. Sometimes you just cant win!

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Tuffy and Jerry are brushing their teeth. Tuffys so tired he uses Jerrys tail instead of his toothbrush. They climb in their respective beds, only Tuffys not in his bed, hes in the palm of Toms hand that Toms made-up to look like a bed. Tom gets walloped for his little stunt but it points out to Jerry that he needs a safer home. What begins with Jerry securing his home from Tom, turns into an arms race between the cat and mouse where they each build their own booby-trapped bunker to protect themselves from each other. They turn out to be their own greatest enemy, with the biggest threat coming from their own creations. In the end, they go back to their relatively safer existence.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: While using a wand to make inanimate objects come to life to attack Jerry, Tom accidentally zaps a marionette (Marie Antoin-marionette). Now the cat and mouse have more on their hands than either one of them can handle! Sure the marionette pulls Hildie and Beaties heart-strings when they are around (both are thrilled to have another girl in the house even if she is made of wood), but the doll delights in getting Tom into trouble when the witch sisters arent looking. When Marie becomes too much for even Jerry to bear, Tom and Jerry have to figure out how to get rid of the little hellion! They brought her into this world, now theyve got to take her out!

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: The Boss shows he’s still got it in the inventin’ department by coming up with a brain-swapping raygun. Just what the world needs. The Boss’ glory is short lived, though, when the raygun starts going off randomly. The Boss and Lamput trade places, and we get to see what it looks like when the worst boss in the world can also freak you out by morphing into orange stuff. Everyone’s acting topsy turvy, so it’s up to Specs and Skinny to straighten things out. Lucky those guys don’t have brains to swap.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series

So instead, Mr Bean decides to go to bed and set an alarm – yet he over-winds the clock and it breaks! With all the shops closed, his only option is to build his own complicated version to make sure he doesn’t miss the comet…

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mrs Wicket makes Mr Bean drive her to the hospital to get her ingrown toenail seen to and asks him to wait. programme.desc: Mr Bean makes his own horror movie and ropes in Mrs Wicket as the star!

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Lamput spends the day at the beach, and, in a pair of swimming trunks, cuts a fine figure indeed. That is to say; a small, round and blobby figure. It only takes one snide comment from a fellow beach-goer to bring Lamputs body issues to the surface. When youre a shape changer, though, theres no need for exercise; before long Lamput is strutting along as an orange amalgam of all the best-looking sunbakers. On the up side, its a handy disguise when the Docs come a-hunting. On the down side? Well, its kind of tiring pretending to be someone youre not. Lamput learns an important lesson from a nearby blobby little girl. Be yourself, and if anyones got a problem with that, they can go find their own patch of sand.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is at the supermarket when he spots a cool fire engine ride – but the security guard makes it clear it’s for little kids only. Not to be deterred, Mr Bean tries everything he can to distract the guard to have his go on the ride. When he finally does get his go, it’s not as good as he thought it would be, especially when a real fire engine has to be called to help Mr Bean!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean peers through the window of the opening party of an art exhibition and sees free snacks being handed around – yum! But he’s told by the bouncer that he needs to be smartly dressed. So he sneaks into the artist’s studio and paints a tuxedo onto himself. This time he’s let in, but will Bean’s fake painted suit last long enough for him to get his free food?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is trying to watch the motor racing on TV, when Mrs Wicket interrupts him to offer a deal – revamp her garden with new paving and ornaments, and he’ll get a month’s rent for free. Bean reluctantly agrees, but when he sees Mr Paliwal finish a personal training session and keen for more, he offers him a new workout… doing all Mr Bean’s work for him while he watches the racing! Win, win!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: In a trampoline park, Bean competes in a race with a boy. The winner gets Teddy. Will Bean and Teddy be separated forever?

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Even for a giant seven foot bear, its not easy getting rid of pesky lemmings but its all fun seeing them constantly try to outsmart each other with cheeky plans.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy wants to try out the brand new packaging format of chocolate spread that he discovers in the rangers cupboard: a yummy-looking XXL jar. And he does not intend to share it with the Lemmings. After observing a chameleon toad that is able to blend into its surroundings, the Lemmings decide to make themselves invisible to attain Grizzys treasure.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: A magic tomahawk divides Grizzy into two identical bears with diametrically opposite personalities: one short-tempered, the other super-sweet. The Lemmings, who did not witness Grizzys split, will have a hard time working out the behavior of their usual enemy, who seems to swing from excessive kindness to the worst trickery for no reason.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: After studying a magazine advertisement with a couple standing in front of an SUV Grizzy imagines that if only he had a nice car his favorite she-bear would be

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: While chasing the Lemmings Grizzy crashes into an arcade cabinet near the supermarket which displays a model fortuneteller and her crystal ball.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: A newly unpacked UV tanning booth holds the place of honor in the middle of the cabin. Grizzy gets it into his head that a classy tan will help him draw the attention of the she-bear hes enamored with. When he opens the box, he discovers that the Lemmings have beat him to it and are already playing "beach party" inside the bed.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings have turned the entire cabin topsy-turvy to organize medieval jousts with the rangers fencing gear. Grizzy, who wishes to recover his couch, tries to straighten up, but is driven out by their fencing foils. To retaliate, Grizzy must find a blade equal to the task. He opts for a fine... frozen swordfish!

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Redbird gets excited when he learns that Batman and Robin are taking him and Bam for a drive up the coast! But when the Joker and his van Prank show up unexpectedly and ruin Redbird’s beach day plans, Bam helps him realize that even though things didn’t go exactly as planned, they still had a great day!

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: After the Joker floods the Batcave, the Batwheels evacuate and relocate to a nearby parking garage.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: When Batman refuses to engage Joker in a race, Prank goads Bam into a rematch. Can Bam learn to not give in to the bullys dares and take the high road?

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: After struggling to solve a riddle from Riddlers helicopter Quizz, Redbird must learn to speak up and share his ideas with the Batwheels.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: When Mayor Foghorn Leghorn hires The Looney Builders to build a lighthouse for Looneyburg, Lola’s tablet breaks and she must rely on herself.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders

programme.desc: The Beaver Brothers hire The Looney Builders to build them a log cabin, but soon sidetrack the job by goofing around too much.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Rick buys Ginger a brand new mattress with a lot of high tech features. Tom is under strict orders to never sleep on it, but Butch convinces him to try it out. Jerry uses the controls against them and soon that mattress is out of control and destroys the entire house.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Tom and Jerry get a taste of the great outdoors on their camping trip to Yosemite. Tom tries hard to get some relaxation but nature and all its inhabitants, including bears, get in his way.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: When Tom and Jerry accidentally ruin Spikes birthday party for Tyke, he forces them to take over. They must entertain and take care of the puppy birthday bash, but no matter what they do, nothing seems to ever work out right.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: When Toodles hires Tom and Jerry to investigate and protect her against a threat to her tuna can inheritance, a mysterious figure keeps trying to hurt them as they investigate. They discover Butch was also hired by Toodles to protect the tuna. Spike, who was guarding the cans, is distracted by the fighting and leaves the cans unprotected. But could it be Toodles wasnt being completely honest with her story?

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ella and Slippy have been practicing their rock-climbing skills, so that they can tackle the recently formed, huge crater on Saturn’s moon, Enceladus. Ella, however, prefers relying on her space boots to get her to the top of the rock wall

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: One little rock can cause a chain reaction by hitting bigger and bigger pieces. Ella inadvertently sends a rock on a collision course for Saturn’s moon, Prometheus. That’s where Ella’s dad has gone to work on a stalled vehicle.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: After hurting her leg, Ella has to take it easy for an entire day. Does she have the patience to sit and rest for that long?

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: When Glitch’s arm shorts out, Ella’s dad has the right tools to fix him. While he’s at it, Dad shows off his latest creation, a Super Towing Arm. Slippy is impressed, and Glitch is more than happy to try it on for size!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ella is enlisted to pet sit Buttons, a friend’s dog, on the very day she has to finish a school project about Venus. She decides to take on both responsibilities at once by taking Buttons with her to the planet to capture the final piece of video footage she needs. When the thunder from the storms around Venus scare Buttons into accidentally detaching himself from his pod, he lands on the pla net and disappears. Ella and her friends search frantically on the hot planet but cannot find him. It’s Buttons who finds Ella! Ella admits she shouldn’t have taken her furry friend with her, but at least she learned new facts for her project!

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Toad commissions a portrait of himself from Mrs. Otter but cant keep still enough for her to paint him. Will there ever be a portrait of Toad hanging in Toad Hall?

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Nothing seems to be biting Grizzys fishing rod and the bear is in despair. Suddenly he spots a fabulous swordfish swimming in the lagoon.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings discover that several drops of Tabasco sauce poured into a rock fault releases powerful sprays of steam that propel them high into the sky on a pot lid.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy has run out of ideas to open his coconut until he sees the Lemmings new friend the crab open one with a simple snip of the claw. He confiscates the crustacean and uses it to take the tops off his coconuts. programme.title: Batwheels

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: To solve the mystery of a ghostly performer haunting her former venue the Gang has to pretend to be a rock band themselves!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Inspired by a wildlife documentary on TV, Mr. Bean dusts off his camera and treks deep into the countryside in search of the perfect wildlife photograph. After two fruitless days of being the hunter, he is somewhat miffed to find himself the hunted.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Its Irmas birthday. Bean writes out two cards - one nice, one silly. He gets his envelopes mixed up and sends off the wrong card.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean breaks his bed using it as a trampoline. He tries to fix it, but he cant. Next morning, he goes to buy a brand-new bed.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mrs. Wicket demands that Bean drives her and Miss Wince to their booked spa retreat; and wait outside in the car until they’re done.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Skinny is being kept awake by a bad case of the hiccups. Half asleep, he guzzles down a midnight drink. Turns out Specs has forgotten sharehouse rule number one: DONT KEEP EXPERIMENTAL LAB CONCOCTIONS IN THE KITCHEN FRIDGE. Skinnys hiccups dont get better. Unless you count "literally turning into a monster every time you hiccup" as "better". No point sitting around shedding on the furniture: Specs puts his newly monsterific buddy to good use as a Lamput-hunter. Which goes well until Skinny gets better. If you count being chased off into the distance by an angry bear as "better".

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: The Docs spot Lamput in the audience of a magic show and try to catch him. The chase takes them backstage where Lamput evades the Docs with the help of different magic contraptions until Specs and Skinny unknowingly ends up on stage. They become reluctant assistants to the Magician who is about to perform some death-defying tricks – with the help of the Docs!

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: While trying to escape from the Docs, Lamput stumbles into a hole in the ground, which leads in an underground civilization with a large tribe in it! Lamput gets misunderstood as the Chosen One according to the tribe’s prophecy. The tribe hails Lamput as the prophet and this proves to be a huge challenge for the Docs to catch Lamput, now that Lamput is surrounded by worshippers and guards at all times!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy discovers the leftovers of a Halloween party in the rangers cabin, which was entirely redecorated for the occasion, with stupefaction. But if the curious ambiance perturbs Grizzy, the Lemmings are in seventh heaven and have a whale of a time jumping up and down inside a cooking pot full of marshmallows. Grizzy wants to get rid of it until he accidentally swallows a marshmallow and discovers the best flavor of his life.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: With their endless battles over the rangers cabin which they do not want to share Grizzy and the Lemmings end up blowing the cabin up.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings encounter a white bear which has drifted all the way to them on a chunk of ice which is slowly melting. The bear makes a fabulous rodeo partner, he just needs enough ice to keep cool. Even a few ice cubes on his head are enough. The only obstacle to this beautiful friendship is Grizzy, who considers himself master of the fridge and thus of the cabins ice production.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy gets rid of the Lemmings by crushing them with one of the rangers heavy trunks, which he immediately clears out of the cabin, his enemies stuck to it like stickers. What he doesnt know, is that the trunk contains a multifunction drone, complete with joystick and virtual reality headset, which enables "embedded" piloting. Thanks to this cutting-edge technology, the Lemmings decide to regain control of the situation!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings discover a strange pond in an American Indian grotto that has the power to rejuvenate anyone who dips in it. They spray a bit of the water of youth onto Grizzy and he instantly turns into a harmless cub they can easily rid themselves of. But the effects of the waters are only temporary.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Before taking a nap Grizzy locks the food in a cupboard to prevent the Lemmings from getting into it.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Little Quacker is heartsick and hes come to the cat and mouse detective to help mend his broken heart. You see, the duck fell in love at first quack with a bird he met luxuriating in the central park pond. The courtship went south (literally) when Quackers honey coo-coo migrated with her flock. All that Quacker has left of her is a single feather and hes counting on the cat and mouse detective to find his one true love. Prince Charming had an easier time finding Cinderella with a glass slipper, but Tom and Jerry arent about to fly the coop. In the end, they find the owner of the lost feather and reunite the two lovebirds who fly off into the sunset...

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: The Cats Meow Dance Competition is coming up and Toodles dance partner has gone missing! In the meantime, Toodles needs a new dance partner in case hers doesnt turn up. Butch and Tom go toe-to-toe for the honor. But when Tom manages to nab the spot, he winds up disappearing, too! Now its up to Jerry to solve the case!

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Ricks got a procedure the next day that requires him not to eat or drink for 12 hours. Thats not a lot of time for a human, but to Rick its a lifetime. He makes a house rule if he cant eat, no one can. Jerry and Spike have a stockpile.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Toms being unusually difficult when hes rocked by an epiphany-- HES LOSING HIS HAIR! Paranoid that hes going to become a hairless cat, Tom will do anything Jerry tells him to do in order to regrow it. Think mud packs (more like mud slaps), hair transfers (one word – furballs) deep tissue massage to stimulate follicle development (a.k.a repeated blows to the head), and skunk therapy (nuf said). Most everything he tries only leads to Ginger throwing him in the bath again. Ultimately, Tom realizes that Jerrys spiking his cat shampoo with hair remover and its about to get hairy for the mouse!

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: When Toms hit by a trolley while he and Jerry are investigating their latest case, hes sent to recover at the local animal hospital. But a detective is never off the case! Tom begins to suspect the answer to the case theyre working on is right under his broken nose. Problem is, hes in traction and cant move. Thats okay, hes got a partner in crime-solving – Doc Jerry makes the rounds at the animal hospital and solves the mystery, but not before sending Tom on the rounds to endure various tests (e.g. x-rays, stress test, physical therapy, etc…) and to do some investigating of his own.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: When a little cat and mouse ends poorly for Tom, he ends up having to wear the cone of shame.

After an unsuccessful class at the dance studio and a trip to the library to teach himself Mr Bean has lost track of time. He needs to make it up to a disgruntled Irma but will his homemade effort ‘win’ her over.

programme.desc: Mr Bean is locked in a department store overnight and has the time of his life.

programme.desc: Mr. Bean becomes obsessed with gaming after being introduced by Mrs. Wickets nephew. He decides he must have his own console!.

programme.desc: Determined to play the piano, Mr Bean finds a tune in his heart and sausages for fingers.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Skinny brings home the wrong laundry bag. Not a disaster, as it happens, since this particular laundry bag contains uncanny super-suits that grant mighty powers. The Docs get heat vision, amazing telekinesis rays, magnetic boots, you name it. All perfect for the person who dreams of… doing the household chores. With great power comes great boringness, apparently. After a satisfying day of getting the house spick n’ span, the penny finally drops for the Super-docs: they realise they have a far higher calling. Is it fighting evil and helping the underdog? Nope, it’s chasing Lamput, same as usual. Meanwhile, however, two actual superheroes really want their suits back. Turns out these heroes are quite into helping the underdog. Which is good news for Lamput, and very, very bad news for the Docs.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: The Docs are in the mountains, doing mountainy things. They look through their binoculars and see Lamput in the distance, doing his own mountainy things. GET HIM! After a dramatic chase across the mountain range, Lamput escapes into a cave and the Docs pursue, but its no ordinary cave. Its the home of a very grumpy dragon who loves his beauty sleep! The Docs are captured and Lamput has to come to the rescue to save the day. Luckily for him, his new forest buddies and his specular musical skills might just help in coming up with a solution.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: The Docs chase Lamput to a haunted mansion populated by ghosts, monsters and all things spooky. Lamput makes quick friends with a ghost prince who happens to be the lord of the mansion, but the Docs run into much less friendlier characters while trying to catch Lamput.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: To escape a snowstorm, the gang checks into a creepy, massive hotel run by a man very strict about the hotel rules established by his deceased mother.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: The gang tours an old Hollywood Studio, but they soon uncover a mystery concerning the ghost of a silent film comedy star who has returned to make sure his recently discovered final film is never seen!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean receives a delivery of a bunch of flowers for Mrs Wicket, but accidentally runs them over in the his car. But will he assemble the bunch and be back in time for Mrs Wicket?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean has to look after Mrs Wicket’s goldfish but Scrapper the cat is keen to ‘help’.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean wins two tickets for an exotic cruise and naturally he takes Teddy along for the trip of a lifetime. Once aboard the huge ocean liner Mr Bean soon settles into a life of luxury but while showing off to a new friend Bean becomes ‘man overboard’ and stranded on a dessert island. The hungrier he gets the wilder he becomes and desperate to find a way off the island.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean hopes to win some cash prizes at the funfair but it’s not as easy as it seems!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean attempts to retrieve his cash card and "accidently" ends up inside a bank vault.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean gets in a flap when a monster turns up in his cake-mix. The good news, though, is that the monster turns out to be a harmless baby bird. The bad news is that it grows into a huge stork and takes over his home. Bean attempts to return it to the wild, and finds teaching it to fly makes his arms ache.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The frogspawn in Beans bathroom begin hatching, and before long the house is full of angry amphibians - just as the mayor is about to arrive for tea.

programme.title: SuperThings: Rivals of Kaboom - Kazoom Power
programme.desc: Three New Kazoom Kids—friends of Finn, Kai, and Mia—appear unexpectedly in Kaboom City.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Monsters and ghouls get in the way of the Scooby gangs adventures as they travel and spend time together in the summer.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Monsters and ghouls get in the way of the Scooby gangs adventures as they travel and spend time together in the summer.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Skinny might be a man of science, but he’s more than happy to get his fortune told for a laugh. The palm-reader sees alarming visions of Skinny’s near future; mostly visions that relate to Skinny being squashed, smooshed or otherwise smeared. It’s kind of Skinny’s own fault; maybe if he paid a bit less attention to chasing Lamput and a bit more attention to not getting squashed, smooshed or smeared, he wouldn’t need constant rescuing by a frazzled mystic.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean receives a delivery of a bunch of flowers for Mrs Wicket, but accidentally runs them over in the his car. He can’t afford to replace them, so he decides to recreate the bunch by taking flowers one by one from anywhere he can - a vase in a cafe, a wedding bouquet, even from between the teeth of a tango dancer! But will he assemble the bunch and be back in time for Mrs Wicket?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Irma is struggling to sell items from her knitwear stall at the market, so sends Mr Bean to collect a sheep costume he can wear to attract customers. Once at the fancy dress shop however, Mr Bean gets stuck in the sheep costume and has to travel back to the market wearing it. Things go from bad to worse when Mr Bean takes a short cut across the field and gets caught up in a flock of real sheep!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean spots a rare book - the Teddy Bear Haunting - in a bookshop, but it’s too expensive to buy. He secretly tries to read it in the shop… until he’s thrown out. To his dismay someone else then buys the book – so he follows the buyer around trying to read over his shoulder. Will Mr Bean manage to get to the end of the book before getting spotted?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean and Teddy are enjoying a day at the arcade, when Mr Bean gets carried away with the dance machine, knocking Teddy onto the floor. Teddy’s picked up, put on a trolley of stuffed toys and figurines – and soon enough, he’s been put in the claw machine as a prize! Mr Bean has run out of coins, so has to find a way of winning Teddy back without looking like he’s cheating!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: A strange object is delivered to the Rangers cabin: an over-board! Its a latest generation skateboard which levitates above the ground without wheels.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy and the Lemmings discover the joys of photography with the rangers instant print camera.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The fridge in the cabin has changed: its been replaced by a brand new state-of-the-art appliance which analyzes the body fat percentage of whoever wants to ser

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy watches a demonstration of balloon modelling on TV. He decides to make a balloon poodle to offer the she-bear hes enamored with.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy needs a nice nap. He cant find a pillow comfortable enough to his taste until he tests the pillow that the Lemmings use as a high-jump mat.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy is awakened from his nap by the unpleasant, ongoing sound of Velcro strips being ripped off. The Lemmings have covered their bodies in Velcro and are throwing themselves against a doormat, which serves as their target. Grizzy finds peace and quiet by getting rid of the doormat until the Lemmings realize that bear fur is an ideal support for Velcro.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The she-bear Grizzy is enamored with has lost her favorite flower in an inaccessible spot under a giant boulder. Grizzy tries to lift it: impossible! He decides to start an intensive bodybuilding routine with the rangers electrostimulation machine, but the Lemmings are already using it on a caribou to step up their rodeo.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: The Legion of Zoom is tired of always losing. They decide to take a page from the Batwheels and try using teamwork in order to pull off a daring heist. But will they be able to work together?

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Redbird sacrifices his stealth muffler tech to sound as loud as the other Batwheels but his modifications backfire when Robin needs his stealthy skills to catch the elusive Catwoman!

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: When Batcomputer shuts down for a system update, the other Batwheels must take over for her while aiding Batman in a battle against Harley Quinn.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: MOE wants to know what its like to be a member of the Batwheels, but the bot gets more than he bargained for when Bam invites him along for an exciting mission to stop Poison Ivy.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: As The Looney Builders build Kathy Bat an upside-down radio station, Porky has concerns but doesn’t speak up.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: Queen Beatrice hires The Looney Builders to build a workshop in her beehive where there is one rule the crew has trouble following.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: Bugs, Lola, Daffy, Porky and Tweety utilise their vehicles to tackle construction projects, all the while acquiring valuable insights.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: The Looney Builders are hired by Penelope Pussycat to build a fashion runway in France where they are encouraged to make their design bigger and more fun.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Tom and Jerry accidentally get locked out in the snow. They chase each other in the winter wonderland, until they realize they cant get back in. They work together to get back indoors as the weather turns ugly.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Jerry causes Tom to lose eight out of his nine lives. Tom uses magic to bring them back, and instead is stuck with eight annoying ghost versions of himself. They try to catch Jerry, who is still too clever for them. Tom decides to work with Jerry and they come up with a magic spell to send these ghosts back where they came.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: When Jerry ventures out of his hole for a late night snack, Tom has a trap set for him. Unfortunately for Tom, he falls into his own trap and gets his head stuck through the wall and into Jerrys house. Jerry tries everything he can to dislodge Tom, and almost gives up hope of ever getting his privacy back.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Detectives Tom and Jerry are hired by Polly the Dog to get back her collar from mean Barkley at the park. After a series of incidents involving the pound "jail" and an electric fence, Barkley reforms when he meets Polly and falls in love with her.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Slippy’s Dad insists he get rid of all his inventions to free up some space. Slippy can’t bear to, so decides to store them on the dark side of Mercury.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: On Sedna, Ella and her friends discover the space probe Voyager 1. Ella takes the Golden Record from the probe and takes it to Mom who reveals that Ella’s greatest grandfather recorded a greeting on it!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Human Day is Ella’s favourite day of the year and she invites Madhu to join her family for dinner. Madhu wants to make a good impression and wonders how to prepare. With Maggie’s help, Madhu learns about the customs of different cultures.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: While checking out a rogue planet, Ella, Slippy and Madhu crash onto its surface. When the heat from underground causes the planets icy crust to burst open, they all tumble down into the darkness and become separated.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ella feels terrible when she accidentally ruins some of her mother’s old photographs. She convinces her family to recreate the scenes in the old pictures into new ones! But things don’t go quite as planned -- a lot has changed in space over the years.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Tinker comes up with a cunning plan for herself and Chief to be delivered as a parcel into Toad Hall. But the journey there proves to be more much more arduous than she could possibly imagine.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Chief agrees to accompany Toad on a day trip, but only if he can drive. Chiefs plan is to steal the car by throwing Toad out, but his erratic driving sees them perched precariously over the riverbank. Can they ever be friends now?

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: When Hedge learns to play chess, she fails to win gracefully. Soon no-one will play with her!

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Ratty tries out his new snorkeling equipment, but Portly mistakes him as the River Monster. An alarmed Hedge exaggerates the story, and Toad tries to catch the monster on camera as all the Riverbankers watch in anticipation.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: The weasels steal Ratty’s rowing boat but soon find themselves in trouble on a fast flowing river.

programme.desc: Mr Bean loses his bottle.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean nearly gets fed to the fish!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: When his car gives up the ghost and he is forced to sell it to the junkyard, Bean builds a hot-air balloon to get around town.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: An encounter with a stuck-up film star ruins Beans visit to a restaurant - and an involuntary swim in a lobster tank makes matters even worse.

programme.title: The Agenda
programme.desc: A weekly talk-show looking beyond the headlines and “accepted wisdom” to find the real story. Hosted by award-winning journalist and presenter Stephen Cole, The Agenda quite simply sets The Agenda . You won’t find the same-old talking heads recycling platitudes; instead thought-provoking guests to debate and explore key issues of today’s world. Using virtual reality graphics to bring subjects to life, Stephen will navigate through subjects ranging from “Prove That Climate Change Exists” to “Who Will Win the Race to Space”. Opposing views will be given opportunity to flourish and develop into a meaningful conversation. The Agenda: No nonsense talk; Challenging perceptions.

programme.title: Razor
programme.desc: CGTNs brand new science and technology show, covering cutting edge developments from all over the world. RAZOR will show you the worlds most powerful laser and the worlds smallest anti-cancer treatment. It will take you from the weird world of quantum computing to the boundaries of the cosmos. RAZOR will show that we are already ""living in the future"!

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: Investigate the facts and myths surrounding UFO sightings in every corner of the world. Examine evidence and eyewitness accounts and explore the mystery of what happened or what didnt happen.

programme.title: Missing In Alaska
programme.desc: Primate sightings in the Alaskan woods have the team puzzled, since experts say that monkeys have never lived in Alaska. The team investigates whether there could be a variety in the Alaska Triangle that is making meals out of men.

programme.title: Warriors
programme.desc: Japan, 1612: Legendary samurai Musashi meets arch rival Kojiro in a climactic duel. Modern-day warrior SFC Terry Schappert goes inside some of the most famous warrior cultures of all time to explore their weaponry, tactics and psyche.

programme.title: Food Tech
programme.desc: Nothing beats the taste of a Southern fried meal and Bobby traces its amazing journey to your plate. In Alabama, Bobby wades among 275,000 catfish during feeding time, and discovers how each fish scooped from the pond becomes a fillet within an hour.

programme.title: How The Earth Was Made
programme.desc: The Marianas Trench is the deepest place on earth. Follow a mission into the abyss and explore the geology that has created this deep scar along the ocean floor.

programme.title: Rome: Rise And Fall Of An Empire
programme.desc: In 450 AD, Rome is a mere shadow of its former self. Gone is the superior civilisation and great expanses of land. As a barbarian, Ricimer could not become Emperor. Yet he held all the power.

programme.title: Lost Gold Of World War II
programme.desc: In the closing months of WWII, legend has it that the Japanese buried something of immense value deep in the Philippine jungle. A group of investigators and engineers are using the latest technology to search for the treasure and the truth.

programme.title: Ancient Top 10
programme.desc: Ancient Top 10 is a smart, fun countdown that details how ancient technology worked, how surprisingly advanced it was, and how it was kind of awesome!

programme.title: Life After People
programme.desc: A range of geology, climatology and archaeology experts give their conclusions as to what life could be like on Earth if the human race dies out.

programme.title: Cities Of The Underworld
programme.desc: In major cities around the world today, skyscrapers loom overhead, taxis honk their horns and street vendors peddle their wares. But below lies city upon city. ‘Cities of the Underworld’ explores this fascinating and unknown history.

programme.title: The Universe
programme.desc: ‘The Universe’ examines how we know what we do about space; Mars, black holes and even if there is anywhere else out there that can sustain human life. This is the story of the scientists and explorers who dared to venture into uncharted territory.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: ‘Ancient Aliens’ examines 75 million years of the most credible alien evidence here on Earth, from the age of the dinosaurs to ancient Egypt to the skies over the western desert in present day USA.

programme.title: Battles BC
programme.desc: Discover how cornered Egyptian soldiers miraculously escaped the Hittites in one of the greatest armed battles of the ancient world.

programme.title: Brad Meltzers Lost History
programme.desc: Brad and the team hunt for the missing White House cornerstone, as well as a lost gun that could prove key to solving the infamous Amityville murders.

programme.title: Lost Relics Of The Knights Templar
programme.desc: This episode features the most dramatic object in the collection – the stunning Knights Templar Sword that Carl and Hamilton believe might have been used at the infamous battle of Acre – the last stand of the Knights Templar in the Holy Land.

programme.desc: In major cities around the world today, skyscrapers loom overhead, taxis honk their horns and street vendors peddle their wares. But below lies city upon city. ‘Cities of the Underworld’ explores this fascinating and unknown history.

programme.title: The Universe
programme.desc: ‘The Universe’ examines how we know what we do about space; Mars, black holes and even if there is anywhere else out there that can sustain human life. This is the story of the scientists and explorers who dared to venture into uncharted territory.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: ‘Ancient Aliens’ examines 75 million years of the most credible alien evidence here on Earth, from the age of the dinosaurs to ancient Egypt to the skies over the western desert in present day USA.

programme.title: Battles BC
programme.desc: Discover how cornered Egyptian soldiers miraculously escaped the Hittites in one of the greatest armed battles of the ancient world.

programme.title: Brad Meltzers Lost History
programme.desc: Brad and the team hunt for the missing White House cornerstone, as well as a lost gun that could prove key to solving the infamous Amityville murders.

programme.title: Lost Relics Of The Knights Templar
programme.desc: This episode features the most dramatic object in the collection – the stunning Knights Templar Sword that Carl and Hamilton believe might have been used at the infamous battle of Acre – the last stand of the Knights Templar in the Holy Land.

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: With Peron toppled from power, Hitler and Bormann could have been forced to flee Argentina. Following leads from declassified files, Bob and John send their teams into Chile and Paraguay.

programme.title: Pawn Stars Do America
programme.desc: Rick, Corey, and Chum are ready to wrangle some wild deals in the Lone Star State. Along the way, the guys test-drive a 1968 Buick Riviera, become riveted by a blacksmiths anvil collection, and meet up with NFL legend, Emmitt Smith.

programme.title: Pawn Stars Do America
programme.desc: Rick, Corey, and Chum are fishin for big deals in the Sunshine State! Between beach days and dinner with WWE superstar Titus ONeil, the gang is casting a wide net in St. Petersburg, Florida.

programme.title: Historys Greatest Escapes With Morgan Freeman
programme.desc: A lone wolf prisoner, with aspirations of writing crime novels, ends up the star of his own break out story when he figures out how to escape from one of Mississippis oldest and most notorious prison farms, Parchman Penitentiary.

programme.title: Historys Greatest Escapes With Morgan Freeman
programme.desc: A German American pilot, Dieter Dengler, uses survival skills honed as a child to escape a secret prison in Laos in the early years of the Vietnam war.

programme.title: The UnXplained: Mysteries of the Universe
programme.desc: Earths moon is only one of hundreds in the solar system, each of them a mysterious and often bizarre world. Could alien moons offer a key to exploring outer space and perhaps even finding a new home for humanity?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Across the globe, reports of mysterious glowing orbs are on the rise. Their movements defy the laws of physics, and now they are even being reported near military bases and nuclear weapon facilities. Do they represent a non-human intelligence?

programme.title: Beyond Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: Andy and Paul deploy the largest piece of equipment theyve ever used to dig deeper into the mystery of the possible alien spacecraft buried in the lower meadow of Mt. Wilson ranch, but their investigation is threatened by mysterious interference.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: While a trip abroad makes old world connections to the new world, on Oak Island, the team is thrilled when new evidence indicates that whoever was on Lot 5, was also deep in the Money Pit.

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: Human can survive catastrophic injuries and deadly scenarios that defy the odds in ways that are inexplicable. Is cheating death when survival is seemingly impossible simply fate or good fortune?

programme.title: Beyond Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: Andy and Paul return to a Colorado cattle ranch that has had 16 mutilations over the last 25 years and features a mysterious bridge that may contain a dimensional portal, uncovering shocking scientific evidence that ties directly to Skinwalker Ranch.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: As winter descends on Oak Island and clues continue to be uncovered, the fellowship makes a final bold effort to find the treasure before operations cease for the winter.

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: Scientists are involved in a never-ending quest to understand the vast universe our planet inhabits. Are there galaxies similar to our own? Could they be capable of sustaining intelligent life? And is that life trying to contact us?

programme.title: Pawn Stars Do America
programme.desc: Rick, Corey, and Chum head to the heart of the Bluegrass State. In Lexington, Kentucky, the team brings a 41 Ford Coupe Deluxe roaring back to life, and legendary Coach John Calipari assists with a University of Kentucky basketball collection.

programme.title: Pawn Stars Do America
programme.desc: Rick, Corey, and Chum are making some revolutionary deals in Boston, Massachusetts. The guys have a wicked awesome visit as they check out a Patriotic painting, try their hand at rowing, and take aim at a Brown Bess musket from the 1700s.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Times a-ticking when a seller brings a Mr. T wall clock to the shop; Rick checks out James Bonds credit card from the 2006 movie Casino Royale; Corey plays with an Atomic Cannon toy; Chum and Rick get down and dirty in Texas looking for fossils.

programme.title: Historys Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: This is the most mysterious of the Dead Sea Scrolls. An ancient treasure map, recorded on a rare Copper Scroll, could lead to billions of dollars of buried treasure in gold, in silver, in jewels. Where is the secret treasure of the Copper Scroll?

programme.title: Historys Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: The Tower of Babel, Sodom and Gomorrah, Mount Sinai are some of the greatest Old Testament stories ever told. Yet these iconic places have seemingly vanished from the map. Where are the Old Testament’s lost places--and what might they reveal?

programme.title: Greatest Heists With Pierce Brosnan
programme.desc: An armoured-car depot employee uses his insider knowledge to plan a heist that could net him, and the longtime friends he recruits, more than $18 million in cash.

programme.title: The Curse Of Oak Island
programme.desc: The team is thrilled yet concerned when the investigation of the Golden Egg, an area that scientific evidence suggest the legendary riches are hidden, immediately shows signs that theyve come...

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: For centuries, fantastic tales of terrifying monsters have fascinated mankind. But what if these creatures were more than just works of imagination and superstition? Could these famous monsters still lurk in a dark corner of our globe today?

programme.title: Pawn Stars Do America
programme.desc: Rick, Corey, and Chum saddle up and head deep into the heart of Texas! In Fort Worth, the trio unearths a treasure trove including a rare Gretsch White Penguin guitar, a Smith And Wesson revolver, and a "Wonder Man" comic signed by Stan Lee.

programme.title: Pawn Stars Do America
programme.desc: Rick, Corey, and Chum are making big deals in the smallest state! In Providence, Rhode Island, the guys cruise over to a muscle car collection, check out a rare book written by John Adams, and take aim at a harpoon gun.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Ancient Aliens is counting down the top ten disasters ever documented with a possible otherworldly connection, from a flying monster at a nuclear incident, a meteor that wiped out the dinosaurs, and a deadly virus that might be from another world.

programme.title: Secrets Declassified With David Duchovny
programme.desc: Stealth ops take a heavy toll—especially for agents living double lives in the shadows. From the ultra-secret “Pond” to a Mossad-run diving resort and a daring rescue in Moscow, these covert missions served a greater purpose.

programme.title: The Unxplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: Deadly forests. Haunted houses. Mountains where visitors never return alive. Are there such things as "evil places"? Places where bad things seem to repeatedly - and inexplicably - happen?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens Special Presentation
programme.desc: Ancient Astronaut theorists have long proposed that Earth is an extraterrestrial laboratory. If so, does it extend beyond humans into the animal kingdom? Accounts of animalist gods can be found across the globe that curiously mirror alien encounters.

programme.title: The Unxplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: Deadly forests. Haunted houses. Mountains where visitors never return alive. Are there such things as "evil places"? Places where bad things seem to repeatedly - and inexplicably - happen?

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, Messy is in the laundry basket, hurling socks around the bathroom. “Green, my favourite! But I wonder what makes green socks green?” He vortexes himself to Okido to find out. When Messy lands in Okido, Felix and Zoe are in the garden beating the dirt out of their tent. Dust billows out in clouds as Messy helps them, but it’s still covered in dirt. Zam asks if they need any help, because she has just the thing!

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: When a comedy of errors causes Orange, Plum and Cherry to arrive late to their campout, they start off their annual tradition of telling tall-tales around the campfire by making up three outrageous, hysterical accounts of what held them up.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry accidentally smashes his mums favourite china teacup.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry needs help making up a story to go with his new drawing.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The Junior Rangers bring a wild boar in their garden back to the forest. There, Ranger Rocky advises the Junior Rangers to find the boar’s sounder, which is a group of female wild boars and their young children.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: Harvey and the new engine Samson are putting the dinosaur models in place for the Earl’s new Dinosaur Park. One of the dinosaurs swings towards Millie and gives her a fright. Samson and Harvey laugh, but Millie gets her own back by asking the groundsman to set his bonfire behind the model of the volcano and making them both think it’s erupting!

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: When Thomas causes a small accident by being silly he is so embarrassed that he blames it on someone else… called Geoffrey, an engine he just made up on the spur of the moment. But Thomas’ imaginary engine raises a lot of questions from his friends and soon Thomas is describing what Geoffrey looks like too. When the Fat Controller wants to meet this new engine Thomas realises that his story may have got a little out of hand!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Grisu has to look after Thingy while his mistress Olivia is away. Grisu has to take the dog to the pet grooming shop to take a bath. But Thingy is a stubborn dog. He refuses to move forward. Grisu And Stella will have to use kindness and to be smart enough to drive the dog through the town. Without listening to his father Fume, who tries to make him use his dragon flame...

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: The shooting of the movie “The monster of the Valley”, directed by the famous Quintin Ratatino, is going badly. A fire has destroyed his mechanical monster and his film crew has deserted the scene. Grisu and Stella help to save the movie. Grisu takes on the role of the monster and Stella helps with the technique. But playing the main part in a Ratatino’s movie is not that easy, evenmore when the director asks Grisu to play the role... of a nasty dragon!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Chilly Autumn winds blow as Little Nutbrown Hare chases the beautiful fallen leaves. When one wafts so high that only a bird could catch it Little Nutbrown Hare wishes he could fly as well. He and Little Field Mouse try every way they can think of to fly, without luck. They have fun trying, however, and along the way they discover they have their own very special talents.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Crisp Autumn days are perfect for collecting pretty golden leaves and playing hide and boo. Little Nutbrown Hare is so excited that he accidently promises to play with two different games with two different friends on the same day. He can’t be in two places at once, so how will he keep both his promises and both his friends happy?

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: The Tomcats now consider Rosie as their "enemy number 1" instead of Scoutbadger. Blinded by rivalry, Scoutbadger is fooled by the cats who turn him against the fox so that they can steal a game of skittles. Our two heroes will finally join together to get back the skittles, especially as these belong to Woodsy…

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team arrive at the Racetrack to build three horse stables the day before a big race. At the sight of the horses, Leo goes into ‘cowboy mode’ for the duration of the build. Henry Corner, the anxious groom, wants the build to be as noise-free as possible for the sake of his nervy horses, which is exactly when the noisy Two-Tonne arrives in reverse. The build progresses well, until, getting carried away lassoing with some spare ropes, Leo scares the horses, who escape from their paddock and kick out at the nearly-built stables in their excitement. The stables collapse like dominos! Bob and Scoop have to round up the horses now galloping around the racetrack while Wendy’s quick thinking and Lofty’s help steers them back safely into their paddock. But the stables still need to be built all over again and now it’s nearly dusk. A contrite Leo thinks he may have a solution, but what?

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Roland’s Gifts is an internet gift shop; Bob, Leo, Scoop, Muck and Lofty are in its huge distrubution warehouse with owner, Roland Sweet. It’s a few days before Christmas and Roland has commissioned Bob and his team to install a hi-tech a robotic picking system, which will pick items off shelving, wrap them and put them into delivery vans via a chute. The system needs to be installed by evening the next day so customers receive their gifts in time for Christmas Day. Scoop and Muck are excited and do ‘robotic’ impressions; Leo claims to be very knowledgeable about robotics. During the installation Leo switches the system on to prove his knowledge to Scoop. Meanwhile an approaching snowstorm has moved the delivery deadline to that very evening.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Huckle and his pals all receive party invitations, but the partys location is a mystery. Small circular marks left behind by whoever delivered the invitations are an important clue. It leads Huckle and pals to Miss Honey whos been walking with a crutch. Grateful for the help she got raking up all her leaves, Miss Honey decided to throw a party for all the volunteers./Huckle and his pals discover a mysterious gigantic spoon.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A game of hide and seek results in the discovery of a baby Sumatran rhino! Leo, Katie and Hero go to Sumatra, Indonesia to return the rhino to its mother.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The Junior Rangers take a young giant panda to China to search for a bamboo forest. But what happens when the panda strays off on its own?

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon is excited about the train on a journey to the mountains with the whole family. After a good nights sleep in their sleeper carriage, they’re still in their pyjamas by the time they arrive!.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In April, the Pigeon post brings the ants a bouncy castle. Its Dr Owls task to invite everyone for the jumping session, but Berry is nowhere to be found. Hail interrupts the jumping fun, but the friends seek shelter in the ant castle. The toy gets damaged, but with the help of a cloud, Berry can also join the jumping. Then the ants rebuild the castle, and everyone happily continues jumping.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Balthazar and Stanley are building a raft that gets carried away by the stream. They end up far from home, but then decide to head back during a storm. Christopher, the canary helps them, but they fall off during a gust of wind. They find refuge in a hollow to rest where they are finally discovered and helped to go home by the Spider. The next day, they play along the stream again, but they no longer worry if the raft run away.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Flutter, the butterfly girl, tries to bake an apple pie, but unfortunately, it doesnt turn out well. With the help of a fairy, she manages to fix it and then finds a lost marker and repairs the window as well. The Lily Fairy discovers that Flutter solved everything on her own and then moves on to help others.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Alfonso, the cricket, invites Bubble, Berry, and Dolly for a visit. They make ice cream and play together. Bubble admits to cheating in the game. Because of this, the little friends come up with a new game where everyone can win."

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The inhabitants of the forest gather on the hilltop to watch the evening meteor shower. Stanley and Balthazar want to build a seesaw but constantly encounter obstacles. The Firefly helps them, and with the assistance of the Moon, they swing on the Moon rocker seesaw. The meteor shower mesmerizes them, then they bid farewell to each other, and everyone starts heading home. The Firefly falls asleep contentedly.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On Reggie Squirrel’s seventh birthday, he couldnt find his friends at home. He runs into Harry Hedgehog, who offers to take him for a ride in a carriage. When they return, the forest inhabitants celebrate Reggie Squirrel together, giving him seven candles as a gift. They then fly in a hot air balloon, marveling at the night sky. Finally, Reggie Squirrel happily returns home and wishes his friends a good night.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Bubble and Stanley gather chestnuts, and then they create marvelous figures out of them at the house of the stag beetle. Bubble takes the figures home, but upon seeing the mess, Stanley offers his help. In the process, they get caught up in a series of accidents, resulting in the gingerbread house breaking. Bubble receives a new gingerbread house from Rosita the rose beetle and happily tidies up his room.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop are building a sandcastle when Pando joins them in the sandpit with his wind-up digger toy to help. Bing finds a lovely ‘poiky thing’ in the sand and thinks it will make the perfect decoration for the top of his castle not realizing it belongs to Pando’s digger.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula collect acorns in the park with Flop, but Bings pile keeps shrinking.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The series follows a pre-school bunny named Bing as he experiences the world around him. It uses small everyday occurrences to demonstrate how he learns new ways to manage situations with the help of his carer, Flop and friends. The programmes central phrase is "Its a Bing thing!" which Flop intones at the end of each episode when Bing has successfully conquered a troubling task or enjoyed a new childhood experience.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Flop is feeling poorly so Bing decides to look after him. When Bing tries to make Flop a honey-lemon drink he ends up making a big mess instead.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda dreams of learning to fly. Excited by Robin Robins statement that anyone with wings can fly, Tilda makes herself some from lettuce leaves. Robin is supposed to give her flying instruction, but she gets bored with all the tedious theory. Molly gets Rupert to help persuade Tilda flying is a bad idea.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Today’s the annual Kite Festival, but there is no wind. So, Rupert builds a wind machine. The machine breaks and the improved version creates such a strong wind not only the kites go flying…

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Edna has a new business idea: restoring old furniture. When the twins Billy and Benny play with paint, they accidentally splatter Robin’s favourite cabinet. Edna is shocked, but Robin loves the result.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: In Winter, Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends try to find an extra special place and extra special food for Feast Day celebrations. When things go awry and nothing seems special at all, they discover that the most important thing is to be able to celebrate with those you love. Theme: celebrating with those you love.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Can you guess how much I love you? Little Nutbrown Hare asks his father. Big Nutbrown Hare looks up at the big, old oak tree. As much as the Old Oak Tree is big? he asks. Little Nutbrown Hare holds up an acorn in triumph. No, as big as this acorn! He replies. Because this acorn will just keep growing and growing and growing.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One morning in the early Springtime, Little Nutbrown Hare wakes to find the air filled with a delightful smell. He and Little Field Mouse search all over the meadow, the woods and by the riverside to find the source of the wonderful smell. They discover all kinds of new and unexpected Spring scents… sweet, pretty and fresh, but will they find the one they are searching for?

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Brewster is assigned to look after Ebo the elephant while some work is done on his enclosure. He decides to show Ebo where he lives. Ebo likes it at the depot because there is a pond to play in and he loves the chug wash. When it’s time to go home, Ebo doesn’t want to go back to the Safari Park. With Koko’s help, Brewster tricks him into the car, and returns Ebo to the park. Ebo is unhappy – until he sees the new water feature, that’s been built for him to play in!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Kai, our innovative genius, has a smell bomb collection of different plants and animals. He collects their smell with his smell collecting capsule before it’s packaged into a handy smell bomb. He wishes to collect the stink of a red panda but he doesn’t know where to find one. The rangers are on it!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: There have been sightings of the mysterious Tanuki, also known as the raccoon dog, in the Japanese forest. Convinced that the myth of a shape-shifting tanuki is true, Kai is determined to capture the evidence with his Kaimera-1000, a state-of-the-art drone with a 10K ultra HD video camera. It so happens that Katie has a new video camera, but it’s (sadly) nothing compared to Kai’s. While slightly doubtful of the myth, the rangers are on it!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Inspired by Nina’s drawing of a rainbow, Tchoupi lists out all the colors within it. When he gets it wrong, Nina suggests they turn it into a game and look for the various hues in Nature. Loving the idea, Mom suggests they go find the colors on the flowers and vegetables in the hamlet. Nina and Tchoupi come back in next to no time, mission accomplished! Recognizing their talent, Dad ups the stakes, setting them the challenge of spotting the rainbow colors… among the animals! Mmm, easier said than done…

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When T’choupi chances upon an old Polaroid camera while rummaging through a chest, Dad sees it as a perfect opportunity to do an animal photo safari in the forest! T’choupi, Nina and Luce love the idea; Luce, especially, is excited at the (unlikely) prospect of spotting a baby tiger! Unfortunately, the animals are difficult to find, keeping themselves to themselves, but the kids manage in the end to take a bunch of cute wildlife photos. All of a sudden, a mysterious creature pokes its snout out between two rocks... Could it be a baby tiger…?!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Fred has found some bowling pins he had as a child. He asks T’choupi and Nina if they want to play but they turn him down, finding the game too old. But when Dad arrives on the scene, his face lights up as soon as he sets eyes on the pins: he had this same game when he was little, and used to love playing it! Seeing their nostalgic dads playing, T’choupi and Nina realize that they too would like to join in. But their fathers are having so much fun that they don’t dare disturb them… Maybe they could make their own bowling pin game, instead…?

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: It will soon be Mother’s Day and Shelley has decided to undertake an ambitious project with the class… which must remain a secret! But secrets are hard to keep when Charley’s mom accidentally finds clues or peeks into Charley’s classroom! The question is: has she guessed what her surprise present is?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia realizes that, despite her efforts to fit in, she will never share all the memories the children have made living in the Mouse Mansion. Sam will help her overcome this difficulty.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia dream of seeing snow falling in the yard of the Mouse Mansion. They decide to do everything they can to make this happen. But such a thing is not so simple, as they will find out!

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: James likes to show off and be the centre of attention, but when he doesn’t get his own way, he sulks and pouts. One day James is showing off so much that the passengers start complaining so the Fat Controller takes his coaches away. James starts to pout and he is still pouting the next morning. He is so sulky and rude that the Fat Controller leaves him in his shed. Eventually James apologises and the Fat Controller gives him some work to do, but when James discovers that he’s pulling waste trucks he starts sulking again and it is only when his friends help him laugh at himself that James finally manages to find a way to dowhat he has to do, and even enjoy it!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: A storm is approaching and Skiff and Joe, the Lighthouse Keeper, patrol Arlesburgh, helping everyone to prepare for it. Duck and Oliver don’t think a ‘tiny little railboat’ should be out in a storm and it seems they are right when Skiff’s anchor rope snaps and his sail unfurls. Skiff is terrified as he gets blown down the track and right into a tree that lightning has brought down across the branchline. When Skiff realises that both Oliver and Duck are heading towards the tree he manages to raise his sail to warn them and avert a serious accident.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou and friends come up with an adventurous plan to save Teddy from Cavegirl Rosie!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Imagination Adventure: Secret Agents Sarah and Caillou try and steal a diamond from Rosies secret villain lair.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Red spots suddenly begin appearing on everything in Busytown from Mr. Rabbit’s mail box to Hilda Hippo’s roof! Huckle ultimately discovers that the red spots are really juice marks made from cherries falling from overhanging trees. / A teeny weeny piano motivates Huckle, Sally and Lowly to try to figure out who would own such a small instrument.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Walking on stilts is difficult even for a talented athlete like Monkey; And it is even more difficult if one stilts breaks and the other gets stuck in the mud…but not to worry, Flamingo is here to save the day. Once out of the mud, Monkey invites Flamingo to play his favorite game… “Monkey See Monkey Do”!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Moose teaches the kids how to slowly cook potatoes outdoors, but their hunger makes them impatient and soon lunch is the least of their worries…

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When Trevor tries to take a photo of the two wild boars that new farmer Annie is transporting, the flash scares them, and Luis the Boar escapes into the river! Annie jumps in after him, but the current is so strong that they both need to be rescued!

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: When the water tower falls across the train tracks at the station halt, it’s Pat’s job to pick it up using his helicopter and a giant super 3 magnet. The Magnet soon starts attracting objects - Alf’s spade, PC Selby’s hat, Pumpkin’s bridle, from all over Pencaster and Greendale. A chase ensues as Amy, Alf and PC Selby race to get their metal objects back from Pat. Pat needs to save the day and lift the water tower off the tracks before the Pencaster Flyer comes into the station…

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Thinking that Margaret is going to move out, the children decide to go into training to become "good children" as they think their numerous quarrels have provoked Margaret’s decision.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Grandpa and Grandma have come to look after the children. In the afternoon, Grandma goes for a walk in the forest with Scoutbadger, Rosie and Berry. Grandpa stays in the burrow with Woodsy who thinks he is going to have a quiet time but things turn out to be more hectic than he had anticipated.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky, Doodleboo and Bubble are raving about a magnificent picture of the seabed... Sketcky and Doodleboo wonder what could hide behind these pretty corals. Bubble has an idea and inspiration for Doodleboo who will make it the most beautiful of his Riddleboos...

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: On the beach, there is a contest for the most beautiful sandcastle and a balloon trip to win. Doodleboo and Sketcky, enthusiastic, would like to participate. Doodleboo knows a very useful Riddleboo.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky shows off in front of Bubble with his old sea bass tricorn. According to him, there is nothing more important for a pirate captain than to have a hat. But Doodleboo has an idea of what can be even more valuable for a pirate!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: A trip to Hatty’s garden shows Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave why apples are just so apple-fantastic - and good for you too!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave each use a special skill to help a friend in need. Their amazing super-powers of sight, smell and hearing, lead little Lost Sheep to a happy reunion with Big Sheep.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The series follows a warm father-son relationship that Little Nutbrown Hare decides he wants a clever long tail like his friends, rather than a short fluffy one. They help out by making him a long tail but all the results are either too tickly, bendy or flappy. When Big Nutbrown Hare spots his son from way across a grassy field everyone realizes that Little Nutbrown Hare’s little tail is clever in its own way.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One Summer’s day Little Field Mouse is very excited to show Little Nutbrown Hare her new favourite thing, a very pretty flower… the prettiest ever! She lets Little Nutbrown Hare borrow it to show Big Nutbrown Hare, but when it blows away during the night Little Nutbrown Hare worries how his friend will react. Will he be able to work up the courage to tell her what happened?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Trying to keep cool on a sticky Summer’s day by the stream, Little Nutbrown Hare and Big Nutbrown Hare have lots of fun skipping stones and throwing sticks.
