When Little Nutbrown Hare discovers that sticks float, the two follow the sticks down the river to see where they go. It’s not an easy chase, and there is a surprise around every corner. Where will the sticks end up?

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing discovers a hole in his favourite yellow wellies but he doesnt want to throw them away in the stinky dustbin.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop hear the familiar jingle of Gillys ice cream van and race across the park to find her. After a long run Bing finally gets his ice cream but as he waves goodbye to Gilly he tips the ice cream out of the cone.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: In the absence of a real plaster, Bing makes one out of sticky tape, but it’s so sticky that it hurts when he tries to take it off.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing loves Arlo the cat. They are friends. Bing strokes the kitty and they play hide and seek, but what happens when Bing meets a cat that isnt as friendly?

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop find a patch of fluffy dandelions and blow all but one. Bing takes the last one to give to Sula but when she hugs him to say hello, the dandelion blows away.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: One autumn day, Reggie Squirrel is visited by his old friend, Otto Badger, who brings a frisbee as a gift. They happily play with it, and when they head home, the frisbee falls at the base of a tree. Later, Berry and his friends find it and play with it, but Balthazar throws it so far that the frisbee vanishes. Reggie Squirrel asks them about it later, but Balthazar denies having seen it. Dolly and Flutter find the frisbee and bring it back to Reggie. Berry, feeling ashamed, admits that they accidentally threw the frisbee and couldnt find it. In the end, they all play happily with it until dark, carefully making sure not to throw it too far.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Leapy, the grasshopper girl, gets paint on her hair while painting her house in the spring. She can’t wash it off, so Zephyr, the dragonfly, offers to cut her hair. Leapy is very sad when she sees herself in the mirror; she doesn’t like her new hairstyle. At Zephyrs suggestion, they show the others, but only Dolly notices the change and compliments her. Later, they hold a hairstyle day, where everyone creates special hairstyles for themselves. Leapy happily finishes painting her house and invites her friends to a spring feast.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Stanleys birthday is approaching, and he becomes very curious and can’t wait to find out what gift he will receive from Dolly. He peeks into the ladybird girls drawer. The next day, he tells Balthazar that he knows what his gift will be. On his birthday, the friends gather and wish Stanley a happy birthday. Flutter presents the cake, they sing, and then Stanley blows out the candles and cuts the cake. Stanley receives many nice gifts, including a bowling set from Dolly. Stanley admits that he peeked into the ladybird girls drawer because he was curious about his gift.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Shaun invites his friends to Sand Island during the summer heatwave. Christopher and Chloe, the two canaries, ferry the friends over. Bubble, Balthazar, Dolly, Stanley, Berry, Flutter, and Shaun build sand houses. Balthazar accidentally knocks down Bubble the flower beetles house. Suddenly, a summer shower begins and washes away all the sand houses. They stand sadly around their ruined creations and decide to build a large drip sandcastle together. Side by side, they build drip towers, construct castle walls, and decorate the tops with sand balls. The day passes joyfully, and by the evening, when the canaries come to pick them up, magnificent drip towers stand tall on the island.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The Pig Twins discover a puddle full of stranded goldfish. Huckle and his pals try to solve the mystery of where they came from. It turns out they were blasted out of the park fountain when an obstruction in the drain hole suddenly got unplugged./ A mysterious message on Sgt. Murphy’s radio has Huckle and the gang baffled!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Everyone knows what happens when a bull sees red, but do you know what happens when he sees red flowers? Ask Monkey, his friend the bull came to visit just as he was picking beautiful red flowers at the farm, do you know what happened? They ended up playing Monkey’s favorite game… “Monkey See Monkey Do”!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Mandy tries to earn her ‘Pioneers Yoga Teaching Badge’ by teaching the rest of the Pioneers the "Upward Octopus" sequence. But constant interruptions test her patience and she ends up stuck on a cliff ledge!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: A Go-Kart Challenge goes topsy-turvy when Peters Go-Kart catches fire and sets ablaze everything in its path!

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Kipper visits Tiger who is in bed with a really bad cold. Tiger is a demanding patient and none of the things Kipper has brought to cheer him up seem to work. In the end Kipper calls Pig and Arnold in to give the patient some of his medicine.

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Pig asks Kipper to look after Arnold and says he’s really tired so he won’t be any trouble. Kipper reads to him, makes a house under the table, turns a cardboard box into a railway engine, but by the time Pig returns, it’s Kipper who can’t keep his eyes open.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi is sad when he learns that Plume the rabbit has hurt her paw. He and Nina decide to take their little furry friend into T’choupi’s bedroom: she’ll be safe in there and able to get a good rest while they take good care of her. T’choupi’s certain this is a good solution. But little does he know… cheeky little Plume has other ideas…!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: It’s Father’s Day today. But neither T’choupi nor Nina can come up with a good idea for a special present for their respective dads. Benedicte suggests they gather up various objects from the forest and make "drawings" with them, on the ground. Great idea… except land art turns out to be a bit more complicated than they expected. And, more importantly, are their dads even going to like it?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Tonight there is a children show for the parents. Julia planned a scooter act with Sam. But Sam doesnt dare to tell her he is very bad on those wheels. How long can he avoid to tell her the truth?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: To help his little brother Ben feel less frustrated by his young age, Sam decided to help him. Together with Julia, they try to come up with a good scheme to make him feel like a hero.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: When Tilda one morning wakes up especially early, she is visited by Robin. He tells her that he as a robin wakes the sun every morning and invites Tilda to join him the following day. For this, however, Tilda has to get up at half past four! That evening, shes so excited she has difficulty going to bed early.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets are fascinated by the story of Aladdin and his wonderful lamp. If only they too could find a genie that would fulfill their wishes! Girl has an idea: she is convinced that Mom has a magic lamp and rushes to the kitchen to grab the gravy boat…that does look a lot like a genie lamp. But now how will they make it work? The Triplets are going to test various techniques with Eliott’s help, who also has a special wish: to not have to finish the dishes!

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Girl would like to play doctor, but her two brothers are not in the mood: « play on your own! We won’t always be together you know? », Turbulent told her. « Not always together »? Girl is quite upset about that and decides to find a solution. How about all working in the same hospital later on? But the children disagree on who will get to drive the ambulance. Luckily, Mom has a solution so that the three of them can stay, together forever!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Rosie has promised to accompany Biva to her exam. However, the very same day, her father Basil arrives unexpectedly.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillous class pet - Gerald the Hamster - passes away the night before Caillou is due to take him home for the weekend.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Rosie is scared to go to the dentist for the first time, so Caillou tries to prove its not as scary as it seems!

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: When railway inspectors come to the Island of Sodor, they start their inspection on Thomas’ branch line. Thomas, Annie and Clarabel are keen to show what they can do, but there are nothing but problems: a stuck window in a hot carriage, naughty schoolchildren pulling the emergency cable and animals on the line! To make matters worse one of the inspectors is very grumpy. But when Annie discovers that he’s left his gold watch on her seat, Thomas sets out to return it and that finally impresses the grumpy inspector more than anything.

programme.title: Chuggington 04
programme.desc: Piper sneaks out of the depot before she is ready and finds out the hard way that she has a lot to learn.

programme.title: Chuggington 04
programme.desc: Dunbar is leaving Chuggington for a while and so the trainees have a new teacher - Skylar. Brewster is not happy and doesn’t think anyone else can fill Dunbar’s wheels.

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: It will soon be Mother’s Day and Shelley has decided to undertake an ambitious project with the class… which must remain a secret! But secrets are hard to keep when Charley’s mom accidentally finds clues or peeks into Charley’s classroom! The question is: has she guessed what her surprise present is?

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave climb to the top of a mountain to plant Tweet’s special flag. A mountain song that describes their actions, as they squeeze under a tree, around a muddy puddle and march over a bridge on the way there, helps them remember the way back home.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi is feeling a bit grumpy. He’s even refusing to play with Nina: our little hero is missing his grandparents and friends back home. But Mom reassures him: it’s normal to sometimes feel a little down when you’re away your loved - ones. To cheer him up, Dad suggests they make changes to the cottage, to remind him of his house back home, and his family! Tchoupi suddenly switches from feeling sad to feeling ecstatic! He’s eager to invite Nina to celebrate this happy day with him… but can’t find her anywhere! This gets him worrying: what if his friend took off because of how unkind he was to her this morning?

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A yellow-eyed penguin wanders into Hero’s kennel. The Junior Rangers head to New Zealand to find the penguin’s home, but can they prevent tourists from disturbing yellow-eyed penguins on the beach?

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The green Grub wants to stay with Dolly for the winter, but always finds her at the wrong time with the request. The Wind accidentally blows the The Green Grub to the seaside, then brings it back to Dolly. Finally, Dolly happily welcomes the Green Grub for the winter and prepares a comfortable bed for him.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly 05 Mepe
programme.desc: Berry the snail and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They have many adventures, while they make new friends and get knowledge about the world around them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The inhabitants of the forest hold a baking contest to celebrate the arrival of summer, but Dr Owl goes overboard with tasting. With the help of Beetle Bodobács, they manage to save the evening with chimney cakes and dancing. The next day, Dr Owl apologizes and improves his mood with a group workout.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a rainy day, Dollys house gets flooded. When the rain stops, Stanley, the stag beetle, repairs the roof. Berry also helps Dolly, who is upset about her soaked drawings. Berry visits Raymond, the copper beetle, who has plenty of bells. He asks for two special bells to cheer Dolly up. At home, he makes coconut balls and later delivers them to Dolly along with the bells, which make her very happy. Later, Berry paints over the stain caused by the rain, and Dolly repaints the pictures with the help of Flutter and Leapy. The bells bring joy to the house.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Flutter, the butterfly girl, catches a cold on a gloomy, rainy day. Doctor Owl examines her and advises her to rest a lot in bed. Her friends visit often to take care of her, and Flutter always asks them to read from her new book. Soon, everyone knows the story, which tells of a ball held in a splendid castle. One day, Balthazar makes Flutter sad by saying that the princess story is just a fairy tale. Flutter turns away, disappointed, and falls asleep. Balthazar meets Doctor Owl, who notices that something is bothering him.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and his friends put on a show in the park. After Coco’s dance, Pando’s song and Sula’s acrobatics display everyone is excited to see Bing’s finale. When he gets up on the stage Bing is overcome with stage fright so his friends, and rainbow fairy mice, come to the rescue.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing tries to show Sula she doesnt need to wear earmuffs to watch the fireworks but when a loud bang sends Bing flying, he doesnt think they are such a bad idea!

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is sad when his new orange balloon pops so Flop helps him make a Bye Bye Box, a memory box for broken toys too special to throw away.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Pando play on the swings together but when Pando takes longer than his turn, Bing gets angry and runs infront of the swings and gets bumped.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is building a tower of blocks when Coco takes some to make a rainbow. When Charlie wants to play with the blocks too, they decide to make a new game they can all play.

programme.title: Bing Bunny - Shorts and characters
programme.desc: Get to know our little pets better through charming stories featuring the characters from the popular Bing series.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon and his little brother Gaspard are going to take the plane to go visit Grandpa and Grandma. And for the very first time, without their parents! Gaspard is a bit scared but Simon is there to reassure him and the nice stewardess takes wonderful care of them. During the trip they are going to be in for lots of surprises: they get to visit the cockpit, experience take-off, get a great tray of food, have magical views out the window…and even the turbulence is cool! When the plane lands, Grandma and Grandpa are there to greet them and Simon and Gaspard are more than ready for their next trip up in the sky!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: As the family are gathering in food for the winter, Berry becomes ill and is the focus of her parent’s attention. Her brothers and sisters, who would rather laze around instead of sorting redcurrants or nuts, notice this. Now, one after the other, they all fall ill… with much playacting. Edmund and Margaret are not fooled and come up with a response as they have every intention of having a relaxed moment tasting some nice, fresh redcurrant juice…

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse discover creatures that can blend in with their surroundings and are inspired to learn just where they can blend in. Little Nutbrown hare becomes disappointed when his white fluffy tail and his dark brown ear tips give him away each time. That’s until he discovers the reeds by the river are exactly the right height and colours to camouflage him perfectly.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Big Nutbrown Hare has a lot to do today. Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse promise to help but there are so many wonderful distractions they forget their promise and let Big Nutbrown Hare down. Luckily they learn a valuable lesson from some bees and get busy to make to things right!

programme.title: Boribon
programme.desc: Boribon receives seven balloons of different colours as a gift from Annalee. However, soon all of them disappear, and Boribon is left with none. Boribon feels sad. In the end, although the balloons are gone, the seven colours shine in the rainbow.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: In the courtyard, Sam and Julia have discovered that snowflakes are formed by beautiful little stars. But how can they preserve these wonders and show them to Julias mom before it melt?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia have adopted a pumpkin theyve nicknamed Leo. But Sams dad is planning to make with it a delicious soup for the whole building. The two friends try anything they can to save him.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The wind is blowing on the beach while the Triplets are really excited at the thought of trying their brand new kite. But because of the wind "ziouuuff" the three sun hats fly away and go into the sea. The children don’t know what to do and look for a way to get their hats back. But by the way, where are going all the items which fly away?

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The boys and Kiko are making a football field to play on the beach, all they need is a fourth player to make two teams. They ask Girl who was picking up shells on the beach. She happily accepts their offer but once the field’s ready, and with no explication at all, Girl starts sulking on her towel and refuse to talk to the boys. Nothing will make her stop, not pulling faces, not Mommies’ hugs, not even candies! What could have possibly happen?

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Wilson takes a test to assess his new Chug Patrol skills, but he forgets something important and fails. Later when a real emergency arises, Wilson handles the situation perfectly and gets Old Puffer Pete out of trouble. Jackman is impressed – maybe Wilson will even make chief one day.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Mandy tries to earn her ‘Pioneers Yoga Teaching Badge’ by teaching the rest of the Pioneers the "Upward Octopus" sequence. But constant interruptions test her patience and she ends up stuck on a cliff ledge!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: A Go-Kart Challenge goes topsy-turvy when Peters Go-Kart catches fire and sets ablaze everything in its path!

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Mouse wants Kipper to push her along on a roller skate. He’s got a better idea. Why don’t they play Hide and Seek? She doesn’t know what it is so Kipper explains that she covers her eyes and counts to ten while someone hides. Mouse hides first but when it’s her turn to count she confesses to Kipper that she can’t count past five. Kipper says he’ll teach her and he does his best but in the end it’s easier to count to five TWICE. But by the end of the game Mouse counts all the way to ten – AND finds Kipper.

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Tiger decides to invite everyone to a fancy dress party. Kipper, Pig and Jake dont know what Tigers going to be dressed as - but the invitation says no one is to come as a pirate!

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: Caillou feels frustrated when Rosie solves all the scavenger hunt clues at Grandma and Grandpa’s beach house. In fantasy, Caillou pretends to be a pirate captain on a sinking ship who learns the importance of listening to his team.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: Caillou doesn’t like Daddy’s chicken dinner, and he says so with a “Yuck!” Going into fantasy, Caillou pretends to be the Silver Knight, cooking a meal for a very picky King (Daddy), and the experience teaches him to express his dislike for something in a more polite way.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas befriends a stray dog who is wandering around the railway and tries to find him a home. In the process, Thomas derails and the fuzzy little dog raises the alarm.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: What was supposed to be a relaxing trip to the hot spring turns into a disaster when the mischievous Japanese Macaques steal the Junior Rangers gadgets.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In this episode, the Junior Rangers attempt to return a crab-eating macaque to the wild. Their knowledgeable friend, Ranger Rocky, assists them in their journey through the rainforest.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Pats delivering new rollers to the car wash but a broken catch on the van leads to chaos.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: The kids and Lauren have gone on a camping trip, but they have forgotten the tent.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants to try Coco’s Hula Hoop. It’s harder than it looks but he finds lots of other hoopy games as he tries. Just as Bing almost gets it right he gets carried away with spinning, trips over and breaks the hoop. Coco is upset that she can’t hula anymore until Bing and Charlie remind her of all the other games they can still do with the bent hoop.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula are in the park playing at being giants and splashing in puddles with their big welly boots. As they play the puddles get bigger and bigger until Bing slips over in the mud and gets wet everywhere. Amma comes to the rescue with a giant warm bath and a giant carroty bagel.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Flop teaches Bing and Pando how to blow bubbles. Bing finally blows a big bubble but gets upset when Pando pops it.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula head off for a picnic at the paddling pool with Flop. But when they get there, they are shocked to find there is no water inside. Bing’s disappointment soon gives way to the realisation that it’s a very special pool day. With no water there are all sorts of games they can play that are usually against the pool rules.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: During Bing’s bedtime routine he inadvertently pees on his blankie and it’s too wet to wash and dry before bed. Fortunately his Hoppity Voosh toy has a cape just as soft and huggy as blankie and it even smells just right too.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswalds piano has one key thats way off-key, thanks to an unseen ladybird who crawls under the lid. Oswald decides to take the piano to Maestro Bingos Music Shop where it will be fixed. On the way, he encounters his friends in numerous predicaments - each time the piano comes in handy helping them out. At the Music Shop, Maestro Bingo prescribes several cures, but nothing works. Finally, the ladybird crawls out of the piano - problem solved!

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald and Daisy find a duckling who’s lost her mother. With the help of the Egg Twins, Madame Butterfly and Johnny Snowman, they search all over town, but can’t find her anywhere. Daisy grows fond of the duckling as it reaches out to her for comfort but, when they find its mother, she reluctantly accepts the duckling is back where she belongs.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team are completing work on a brand new fitness trail in the sports stadium park. They must finish before the afternoon’s Spring City Fun Run - a steeplechase across the fitness trail obstacle course, organised by Scoop’s idol Skye Sampson, a fitness guru and world champion record-breaking athlete. When Scoop is told that only humans will be competing, he sets up his own competition: the Muscle Machine Games! With events including “Weightlifting” (with a pallet of wooden beams) and “Discuss Throw” (with an old tyre) Lofty and Muck both break new records...

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Mayor Madison has arranged for Ballroom Blitz, TV dance sensation, to come on tour to Spring City. When star dancer, Sylvain de Souza, threatens to cancel the show unless he gets a sprung dance floor, Maria enlists Bob to save the day, in return for a show tango with her hero. Dance fever sweeps Team Bob and the Spring City Rockets but Lofty despairs of ever being able to dance as well as the others. Just as he finds his dancing mojo, Lofty accidentally wrecks part of the sprung dance floor. Sylvain recognizes a kindred spirit in Lofty and urges him to follow his dreams, no matter how unlikely they may seem.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare follows some unusual tracks in the snow that eventually lead him to a shy little spotty deer. He plays with his new friend every day, until she has to leave again with her mother to search for food. Little Nutbrown Hare is sad to see her go, but he’s also glad that he has friends that stay in the meadow all year round.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The snow in the meadow is so deep that Little Nutbrown Hare has to stay under the Old Oak tree. Wondering what he is going to do all day in deep snow and with no one to play with, his imagination soon takes over as he creates new kinds of fun. By the time his friends reach him, Little Nutbrown Hare can’t believe how the time has flown!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: On a cold but sunny morning in the middle of Winter, Little Nutbrown Hare discovers his friends ice-skating on the frozen pond. He decides to give it a try but slips, slops and slides all over the ice. Will he persevere for long enough to be able to perfect his own unique style, or will he be put off by the natural skill of his friends?

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: The class is having a picnic and everyone is happy. Especially Paxton! Learn about healthy snacks with Otus, Stripey and Yabba.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: When Huckle, Lowly and Sally find a lost bag, they use the eyeglass case, atomizer, map, and a red scarf inside it to determine that the owner is a famous international opera star who’s come to Busytown to perform for the first time./Cyclists getting flat tires somewhere in Busytown lead Huckle and the gang on a mystery.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, Messy is surrounded by his usual mess! Hopping about, he asks himself why fish live underwater, but birds live in trees? When you need to know go to Okido! Messy lands with a somersault onto his bottom and finds Felix and Zoe are painting their house. “Why?” asks Messy. “You have to take care of the place you live in Messy”, explains Zoe. And just at that moment an alarm goes off… It’s a Cloudship emergency!

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, Messy is trying to fly, and doesn’t understand why he can’t. So he jumps into the vortex to go to Okido and find out! When Messy bounces off the trampoline in Okido he flaps his little arms to turn the bounce into flying but he lands with a bump onto his bottom! Zoe and Felix laugh at him for trying to fly, and tell him to go with them to hear Mayor Oki’s AMAZING news. Messy loves anything amazing, so they skidoodle on down to Okido Park.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: At the girls campout, Sour launches into a whopper of a yarn about the adventures she and Sweet had in the "Berry Deep Dark Forest." She tries to get Sweet to participate in spinning the tale, but Sours over-the-top performance leaves Sweet behind. Toward the end, Sour graciously changes the story to pull Sweet into it, giving Sweet the opportunity to toss in an ad lib that makes a nice topper to Sours story. Sweet is thrilled when everyone applauds her, even Sour, who is impressed by her contribution and proud of her sister.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: When Harry is disappointed that none of his wishes come true in the real world, the dinosaurs take him to visit the wishing well.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry, Charlie, and the dinosaurs are playing at being pirates.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Who’s that hopping into the garden? Why, it’s a yellow-footed rock-wallaby—and its baby! The Junior Rangers hightail it to Australia to send mother and child home, but will a couple of flat tires throw a spanner in the works?

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: The Fat Controller sends Thomas to the docks to collect a very important Christmas parcel. Unfortunately Cranky drops it when he is unloading a ship and hearing the way the parcel rattles thinks it must be broken. He tries to hide it from Thomas so that nobody will find out what he’s done. But the Fat Controller does not give up so easily and neither does Thomas and with the help of Salty the parcel is soon discovered again. Thomas sets off to deliver it at last, but slips on the icy tracks, dislodging the parcel and thinks he must have broken it too. When the Fat Controller opens it the surprise turns out to be a surprise for Thomas and Cranky too!

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: Kevin is very excited by the snow, but Victor doesn’t like it at all. He explains to Kevin that the snow is causing all sorts of trouble. Emily is stuck in the Steamworks, because the parts she is waiting for are on a truck that’s stuck in the snow at the depot. When Kevin goes outside some snow falls off the roof trapping him too. Victor thinks Kevin’s gone to try to fetch the truck from the depot and sets off to rescue his friend. Luckily Thomas has been sent to the depot too and is able to find Victor before anyone else gets stuck in the snow!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Grisu is entrusted with what seems to be an easy mission. It consists in moving a beehive in a field of honey flowers. But things get complicated when an accident occurs, and the beehive gets lost. Moreover, Grisu has to deal with Fume who has a sore throat and cannot spit fire. Grisu will finally succeed in getting the bee queen (and the other bees) into the beehive thanks to Miss Gertruds perfume. And Fume will be cured thanks to the honey!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Natureza is on the ice cap conducting a polar bear study. She still has one last bear to tag but its too fast. So she needs a snowmobile pilot to help her approach and tag the beast. Its a perfect mission for Grisu who is no snowmobile pilot, but can adapt to anything and is impervious to cold! As he lands on the polar cap, Grisu unwittingly wakes up the napping bear and is chased after by it. He gets out of his bind thanks to Natureza. As theyre getting ready to tag the bear, Grisu, unwittingly again, burns the snowmobile engine. The mission seems compromised, but a firefighter never gives up! Resourceful Grisu uses his wind-filled parachute to pull the snowmobile and thanks to him, Natureza ends up tagging the bear.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: A fun, spooky tale from little White Owl leaves the friends a little on edge, so when they hear strange noises in the pumpkin patch, they wonder what kind of creepy creature might be lurking there with them. Will Big Nutbrown Hare be able to convince them not to let their imaginations run away with them?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The friends are all playing together in the Autumn meadow. Little Redwood Fox inadvertently spoils all the games of the day, but the others put their heads together and come up with a game that suits her perfectly.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Edmond lives happily with his three little badger cubs in their underground sett. One day, he falls in love with Marguerite, a fox! Marguerite and her daughter move into the family home, turning life upside-down for everyone, who now needs to find a new way to live together in harmony.Directed by: Florian Ferrier (France, 2018)

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Team Bob are preparing to dig the foundations for a skyscraper in Spring City’s new business zone and are under pressure from Mayor Madison to get started. She keeps interrupting their work on Bob’s smart-phone. Scoop and Muck set a challenge to see which of them can dig/clear the earth quickest. Interrupted again, Bob calls a halt but the machines get carried away and keep digging. Scoop goes too deep and hits into something hard underground. Bob calls Anish Bose, the archaeologist, who announces the discovery of Roman ruins. The build will have to halt while they excavate the site. Scoop is filled with remorse and horrified to learn that Romans didn’t have machines like him. An interested crowd starts to gather as Anish discovers more artefacts. Mr Bentley arrives for a progress report but rather than being angry at the lack of progress he is excited by the historic discovery.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: It’s Christmas time. Bob and the team are building the Spring City Christmas display in the city centre’s plaza. Lofty loves everything Christmas and decorates the yard in snowflakes. Then he sees that Bob’s home doesn’t have any decorations, so he decides to give him the perfect present. Lofty arrives on site, determined to give Bob his Christmas present but when asked to help hang the lights, he puts the present down by the giant display tree. Lofty finishes his work and again tries to give Bob his present but now it’s lost somewhere in the display.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Something knocks Sgt. Murphy’s hat off his head, chops the tops of Baker Humperdink’s baguettes, and sheers a path through a flower bed. Although no one saw anything, they all heard it make the same whoop whoop whoop sound. Putting the clues together, Huckle, Sally and Lowly figure out that it was Vanderbuilt’s new, out of control, boomerang./The mysterious disappearance of Mayor Fox leaves Huckle and the gang on an important search.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo, Katie, Hero and a sun bear cub set off for the rainforest to find the cub’s mother. Alas, they end up trapped in an overgrowth of stinky Rafflesia flowers! Can the Junior Rangers, Hero and sun bear cub overcome the overpowering odour of the Rafflesias and escape?

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A pygmy hippo appears in the garden pond. The Junior Rangers hit the road to send the hippo home, but their journey is delayed by a sticky situation involving quicksand.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon, Gaspard and Maelle are building a sandcastle at the beach when they spot a weird-looking creature, but can they convince anyone else that it actually exists?

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The green Grub wants to stay with Dolly for the winter, but always finds her at the wrong time with the request. The Wind accidentally blows the The Green Grub to the seaside, then brings it back to Dolly. Finally, Dolly happily welcomes the Green Grub for the winter and prepares a comfortable bed for him.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly 05 Mepe
programme.desc: Berry the snail and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They have many adventures, while they make new friends and get knowledge about the world around them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The inhabitants of the forest hold a baking contest to celebrate the arrival of summer, but Dr Owl goes overboard with tasting. With the help of Beetle Bodobács, they manage to save the evening with chimney cakes and dancing. The next day, Dr Owl apologizes and improves his mood with a group workout.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a rainy day, Dollys house gets flooded. When the rain stops, Stanley, the stag beetle, repairs the roof. Berry also helps Dolly, who is upset about her soaked drawings. Berry visits Raymond, the copper beetle, who has plenty of bells. He asks for two special bells to cheer Dolly up. At home, he makes coconut balls and later delivers them to Dolly along with the bells, which make her very happy. Later, Berry paints over the stain caused by the rain, and Dolly repaints the pictures with the help of Flutter and Leapy. The bells bring joy to the house.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Flutter, the butterfly girl, catches a cold on a gloomy, rainy day. Doctor Owl examines her and advises her to rest a lot in bed. Her friends visit often to take care of her, and Flutter always asks them to read from her new book. Soon, everyone knows the story, which tells of a ball held in a splendid castle. One day, Balthazar makes Flutter sad by saying that the princess story is just a fairy tale. Flutter turns away, disappointed, and falls asleep. Balthazar meets Doctor Owl, who notices that something is bothering him.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Mama Owls chicks are born, and soon they are strong enough for Berry and Dolly to visit them. Doctor Owl asks for their help while he works. The owl babies are very lively, and Berry and Dolly play with them enthusiastically and patiently. At lunchtime, Mama Owl is running out of patience, but eventually, they manage to feed the chicks. After finishing lunch and resting a little, the little ones regain their energy. They happily jump around Mama Owl, who feels it is time that the chicks learn to fly.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Alfonso, the cricket, plays beautifully on his violin for the forest inhabitants, but one day, no one listens to his new piece. First, he looks for Berry, Balthazar, and Stanley, but they are busy. He goes to Dolly, but she doesn’t have time either. Very discouraged, he decides to leave the forest. However, he meets the Magpie, who welcomes him and cheers him up. Meanwhile, the others begin to search for Alfonso. When they find him, they apologize and invite him to play his new piece at the playground opening.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula and Pando and me did music all together.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula are playing a vooshing game with their favourite toys, Hoppity Voosh and Hippo Fairy. They throw them into the air to see how high they can fly – Voooooosh! Uh-oh…Sula’s hippo gets stuck in a tree so Bing throws Hoppity up to save her, only for Hoppity to get stuck too.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Pando are playing outside in the cold, blowing steamy dragon breath at each other and discovering icicles hanging from the tap. Flop makes hot chocolate to warm everybody up but Bing can’t wait for it to cool down before he can drink it and burns his fingers – Pando’s quick thinking brings the icicle to the rescue.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Charlie is coming to play and Bing has planned lots of things for them to do. But when Charlie arrives he doesn’t want to play any of the games Bing has put out. Bing is upset until Flop suggests they watch to see what Charlie really wants to do. Charlie heads straight for the kitchen where he, and Bing, have a great time making music with pots and pans.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Frogs are staying at the Guesthouse Appleseed to collect leaves. When Tilda discovers a beautiful portrait of herself, she asks Rupert, who also received a portrait, and they search for the artist.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: The big neighbourhood race is coming up, and Snaily, who came in last place last year, dreams of winning this time. He discovers his talent on Billys skateboard, but the rules stand in his way.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda is excited about the cake contest, but when she burns her hands, she can’t bake anymore. Her friends at the Guesthouse Appleseed decide to help her by creating a special cake together.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare watches as Blue Bird’s eggs hatch into three happy, chirpy baby birds. Fascinated and charmed by these youngsters, he visits them every day and even helps teach them to sing, play and fly. But how will he feel when Summer is on its way and they are ready to fly the nest and make homes of their own?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: It’s Spring blossom season and the pretty pink blossoms that come floating down the stream remind Big Nutbrown Hare of a magnificent cherry tree from his youth. He sets off cross- country to find it, with Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse, but the journey is longer and harder than he remembered. Will the blossoms floating downstream give them a clue as to a shorter way home?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends go on a hunt for treasure in the meadow and collect all kinds of unique gems like flowers, feathers, apples and egg-shells. But there’s a hole in Little Nutbrown Hare’s leaf-bag and he loses the precious collection along the way. Luckily, Big Nutbrown Hare is not far behind to collect the lost treasure as well as follow its trail to find his son.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: To earn their badges, the trainees must devise a fitness routine. Wilson climbs on the train jack and has Lori move him up and down. But Lori points out that she is the only one getting a work out! When Wilson tries to move off the jack his wheels spin and spin and he discovers it’s the perfect ‘stationary bike’ for a chugger! He demonstrates his wheel work out and wins his badge

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The Junior Rangers teach a city Lyrebird - who can only mimic dreadful man-made sounds - the beautiful song of nature to help him blend in with wild Lyrebirds better. But is it so bad to be different?

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Its movie night! But first, the Junior Rangers have to teach a Binturong how to climb trees.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and Nina are having fun discovering various animals’ houses. When they realize butterflies don’t have a house, they decide to build a beautiful "Butterfly Hotel!" But when the edifice is finally ready… another animal - one that is not at all to T’choupi’s liking - moves in instead!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When Nina asks T’choupi to accompany her to the forest for a fitness session, our little hero gets very excited… until they reach the location and there’s no fitness trail in sight! Nina laughs: that’s the funnest part about it - they’ll use the tree trunks, boulders and branches to make their own parcourse! T’choupi drags his heels as he follows Nina through the "trail." Then, when he trips and falls, he wants to call it quits… But what if he were to invent his very own fitness trail in the forest? Wouldn’t that be fun…?

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: While looking for a lost toy under a bunch of crates, Nina and T’choupi discover some very strange hairs belonging to some unidentified animal … In a mystery, the two friends head off to inspect all the animals of the hamlet in an attempt to track down the owner of the strange fur... But a big surprise awaits them…!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Charley’s mission this week is to ring the school bell. But when he is in the hallway by himself, he sees a strange little mysterious shadow… Could it be a ghost? Charley goes pale. His mission has all of a sudden become very stressful!!

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Tonight there is a children show for the parents. Julia planned a scooter act with Sam. But Sam doesnt dare to tell her he is very bad on those wheels. How long can he avoid to tell her the truth?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: To help his little brother Ben feel less frustrated by his young age, Sam decided to help him. Together with Julia, they try to come up with a good scheme to make him feel like a hero.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia have decided to play doctors to help their friends stuffed animals and heal dolls hurts. Dr. Julia and Sam, her nurse, pay visits to some of them in the Mouse Mansion.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When the Fat Controller gives Daisy the job of conveying some special passengers up to the holiday town of Harwick, she gets carried away with the responsibility – deciding that, because she is a very special engine, they must be very special passengers! Not stopping for a group of children with sticky ice lollies and refusing to pull a dusty baggage truck results in the passengers not being able to perform their puppet show! Once the audience has been specially bussed in for the show, Daisy is humbled as she becomes a puppet stand for the performance of… a Punch And Judy puppet show!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas loves to race against Max and Monty, the cheeky dumper trucks. But, after one near accident too many, he decides he must ignore them if he wants to get on and be Useful. But, without Thomas to race against, Max and Monty muck about at the building site and Oliver is damaged. Then they race against the other construction vehicles, to see who can get their work done quickest. Rather than driving all the way to the dump, Max and Monty chuck all their building debris over a wall… not realising that the rubble is blocking Thomas’s branch line! When Thomas returns with Oliver, he ploughs into the pile of dirt and rocks and is derailed. So Max and Monty have to stay up all night clearing the line!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou falls from his bicycle whilst out with Daddy and breaks his arm. Has to adapt to life in cast, which isnt very fun.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillous family visits an old castle, and Caillou’s inspired by an old tapestry to imagine himself as a wizard in Arthurian legend.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: A mysterious giant circle appears in the middle of a corn field. Although Pig Will and Pig Won’t are convinced it’s the landing site of an alien flying saucer, Huckle puts the clues together and ultimately goes up in a hot air balloon to reveal the flattened area is actually Vincent Van Goat’s latest artistic endeavor./When flying potatoes are dropping from the sky in Busytown, Huckle and gang are determined to find out why.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Trying to see as much of the beautiful savanna’s view as possible; Monkey climbs higher and higher up the tree. At this height there is only one friend Monkey can meet… the Giraffe is ready and willing to play Monkey’s favorite game Monkey see Monkey Do.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Charlie takes Sarah, Mandy and Norman out to sea. But the kids tussle over who should be captain until Charlie is knocked into the sea and Norman causes the engine to catch fire.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: While Lizzie teaches at the Fire Station, Norman and Hannah help keep things running at the Pontypandy Vets… except both sheep manage to escape AND Norman startles Prince the horse, who runs away and gets stuck in sinking mud at the tidal flats!

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Pat has to deliver a hibernation box to Amy for Dora the Doormouse. Meanwhile the children are looking for a clubhouse for their superhero club. Pat collects the shed from the Sorting Office and uses his helicopter for the delivery but disaster strikes when the shed lands in a tree! When it turns out the shed is not what Amy had ordered, Pat saves the day by making a special home for Dora with cardboard boxes and the shed becomes a special treehouse for the superhero club.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Pico and Rosie do not agree with the day’s plans made by their respective families. Pico dreams of having some independence while Rose wants calm and attention. They decide to change places.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Rosie has promised to accompany Biva to her exam. However, the very same day, her father Basil arrives unexpectedly.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Seeing Bubble miming one of Doodleboo’s waltzes, Sketcky sees Bubble very well participating in the princess ball, but he lacks something to get there. Sketcky has no idea, but Doodleboo has one, perfect for princesses.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky got his kite stuck on top of a tree and wonders who could help him untie it. Thanks to Doodleboo, hes going to make a very funny and agile friend help him get it back.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky sees himself with Bubble as marine explorers. Bubble wonders how Sketcky could do it if he does not know how to breathe underwater. Doodleboo arrives timely to their rescue.

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Tweet wants a special star like the one in her favourite book. Her friends help her find star-shaped things on their adventure, but they have to wait until it gets dark to find the perfect star in the night sky.

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave discover how to keep themselves and others safe when using the road. They follow simple roads signs telling them when to stop and go, and help a confused chicken cross the road!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Summer is at its hottest and Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse want to run and play but the sun is just too hot and strong. That’s until Little Grey Squirrel gives them both a wonderful present, big leafy parasols. When he later changes his mind and takes Little Nutbrown Hare’s parasol back, the little hare is naturally disappointed. Can the friends find a way for all of them to be happy?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: You Summer in the meadow is a great time to find tasty snacks to eat. Big Nutbrown Hare seems to know all the best tricks and hiding spots for the yummy treats and Little Nutbrown Hare can’t help but wish he was as big and smart as his father. However, he soon finds out that there are some things a little Nutbrown Hare can teach a Big Nutbrown Hare.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: On Summer’s hottest night Little Nutbrown Hare finds it hard to sleep. When a swim in the river isn’t enough to cool him down, Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends ask Little White Owl to tell them a really cold and sleepy bedtime story. Will she come up with a story that can make them feel cool and finally get Little Nutbrown Hare off to sleep?

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is vooshing with Hoppity around the garden, making him fly higher and higher. With one particularly enthusiastic throw Hoppity disappears. After a hunt, Bing finds Hoppity in the washing up bowl and gets upset because a wet, mucky Hoppity just doesn’t feel right.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and his friends play Nature Explorers in Ammas garden by spinning a giant colour wheel and then finding something of that colour in the garden.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing has enough money to buy one thing in Padgets shop but he finds it hard to choose between all the lovely things. After much deliberation Bing chooses a campervan but on the way home he begins to regret his decision.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Its bedtime but wheres Hoppity? Bing remembers playing with him in the garden so Flop finds a torch and together they set off in the dark for an adventure.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: If you get stuck, you need some help and then you can get down by yourself.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: At the end of summer, the Star Girl visits her friends. She rarely comes because her star-shaped house is in the sky. They spend a day together, and when night falls, the Star Girl bids everyone farewell. She can’t speak, but she plays the harp beautifully. The music will lift her house into the sky. However, this time one of the harp strings comes loose, and the house doesn’t rise. The Wind blows the string out of her hand, and she can’t catch it.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The Centipedes apple tree hasn’t had any fruit for many years. He asks Berry for help, who carefully tends to the tree. At the beginning of summer, apples finally appear, and the Centipede is so happy that he invites his distant relative, the Millipede, for a visit. However, the Millipede falls ill and can’t come. The Centipede then invites his friends to a big apple party. When they arrive, they pretend that the Millipede was there, but it turns out that it was just his friends in costume.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The Cave Spider and the tiny Spiderling are good friends, and one summer day they are walking on the mountaintop. Spiderling blows a dandelion at the Cave Spider, who falls and gets injured. Spiderling immediately seeks help from Doctor Owl, who determines that the Cave Spiders legs are bruised and prescribes two weeks of rest. Berry, Dolly, Stanley, and Balthazar help the Cave Spider get home. Dolly suggests they sew a large canopy so the Cave Spider can watch the ants end-of-summer fireworks from the air. Flutter, Leapy, Zephyr, and the others make the canopy, and on the night of the fireworks, they lift the Cave Spider up so he can enjoy the view from above.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a spring day, Alfonso finds an unknown seedling by the stream. The cricket carefully guards the plant, which soon produces a special flower. Alfonso waters and tends to it daily, happily watching it grow. One morning at the end of summer, Alfonso notices that the flower has wilted and its petals have fallen off. Sadly, he gathers the petals and brings them into the house. In the afternoon, Dolly visits him, and later his friends come over to cheer him up. They bring delicious pancakes, but Alfonso is still sad. They go out to the stream, and Alfonso scatters the flower petals into the water, bidding them farewell with tears.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The kids find some numbered papers blowing around the park. After investigating several possibilities of where they could be from, they finally figure out they were once fastened to trees in the park as part of a self-guided tour to celebrate Arbor Day. / When all the milk in Huckle’s Dad’s store turns out to be sour, Huckle, Sally and Lowly set out to find out why.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey is hungry, oh so hungry, but he cannot find anything to eat, when all of a sudden, a nut falls from above followed by another and another…it is Squirrel, his good friend! Seeing how fast Squirrel moves around, Monkey is inspired to play his favorite game… “Monkey See Monkey Do”!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: The Why Files (Norman and Hannah) investigate a mystery involving spilled milk, a half-eaten sausage roll, and strange ‘dog like’ footprints…

programme.title: Kipper

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Kipper and Pig see kangaroos and helicopters in the cloud shapes. Suddenly Arnold walks up a rainbow and Kipper has to go and find him. Is it all a dream?

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Tchoupi and Nina come across a waddling hedgehog while they’re playing in the vegetable garden. When their moms explain how beneficial these cute little creatures are to gardens, the two friends decide to do everything they can to make the hedgehog feel at home among the vegetables… Until the little animal… disappears!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When T’choupi comes down for breakfast this particular morning, he finds the kitchen in a total mess! Nina comes and tells him that the vegetable garden has also been turned upside down! Who could possibly have done this?... At first, they suspect Ciboulette the cat… until they find out that the culprit is a super cute newcomer.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia have decided to play doctors to help their friends stuffed animals and heal dolls hurts. Dr. Julia and Sam, her nurse, pay visits to some of them in the Mouse Mansion.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
